Author: SPRRW
Title: [ANN][ICO] UDIAR - Blockchain-Based Copyright Depository
Body: The UDIAR Marketplace is a service that unites sellers and buyers from all over the world who are focused on development and technologies, science and/or production methods. The author may put his object on sale and any interested person can obtain it in the form of a licence or an exclusive right. When selling copyrights, a new record confirming the transaction is created in the UDIAR blockchain register. UDIAR provides the opportunity not only to sell ready-to-work developments, but also to order them on the open market in the same way as it is now taking place on numerous freelance exchanges in the Open Innovation process. Join ICO on https://udiar.io/ and help authors to monetize their creativity!  Join UDIAR pre-ICO now on udiar.io to get your 30% October bonus immidiately!

Author: SPRRW
Title: [ANN][ICO] UDIAR - Blockchain-Based Copyright Depository
Body: UDIAR tips for creative people  Copyright protection is not just uploading of your art/science work to any website. It is not about only tracing the cases of unauthorized usage of your creation in internet or offline. So simple, but still not understood: protection starts with registration! As many IP litigators and experienced authors repeat all the time: claim your copyright prior to any publishing. This is absolute rule, no exceptions even for blockchain-based services. So many startups on IP field appeared recently. They have really promising solutions for copyright holders. Indeed, blockchain is a technology aimed to facilitate the process of copyright examination, data encrypting, tracing and many other issues but first one should register ownership through the real personal identification. Anonymity have nothing to cope with this. That is why udiar.io will be always few steps forward - it is real IP agency rooted in legal terrain and using future technologies as fertilizers for generous growing.  Visit our BLOG for more information.

Author: wrc206
Title: [ANN][ICO] UDIAR - Blockchain-Based Copyright Depository
Body: Why do you need 2 blockchains?

Author: SPRRW
Title: [ANN][ICO] UDIAR - Blockchain-Based Copyright Depository
Body: Hi. Indeed) We need them to overcome 2 main limitations (or to say, features) of blockchain. First problem is the data volume limit. Second – anonymity. Anonymity is couldn’t be implemented fully in case of recording the copyright since we need a real identified person to be vested with a right for intellectual property) and unchangeability of recorded data. We will use 2 different blockchains for this purpose. First – the private one which will record complete information essential for convenient copyright fixation: 1).the object (it could be text, music or image files, 3D-model or scheme), 2).the description of the object (text notes from creator about what is about and/or what is it for, what is it made of or any other necessary information which could describe the object and 3).personal ID data of the author. Once the depositing (timestamping) is completed, the generated hash will be recorded to the public blockchain (the second one) and therefore accessible for everyone. Thus, private blockchain enables us to record a large volume of data, and public blockchain gives a transparency and excludes the risk of any retroactive changes and falsifications.

Author: SPRRW
Title: [ANN][ICO] UDIAR - Blockchain-Based Copyright Depository
Body: Hi everyone. We have some good news for you! 3rd October 2017 was the date of the first registration of copyright in a decentralized public blockchain-based register. This was the first step in developing UDIAR - a united marketplace for intellectual property. The first to be deposited were the brand’s design, a music track and a literary work. All authors of registered objects received certificates than confirm their rights to the objects and will forever remain in the history of the industry. All data on every object that has undergone the deposit procedure, and the entire history of changes are forever saved in the blockchain, which enables their guaranteed protection from counterfeiting. Currently, it is possible to verify the hash of the copyright registration transaction using the standard means of the Ethereum platform, and after the full launch of the distributed register – by the means of the UDIAR platform.

Author: SPRRW
Title: [ANN][ICO] UDIAR - Blockchain-Based Copyright Depository
Body: Who will benefit from cooperation with UDIAR? First what comes to mind is so called "Creative Class" which comprises people whose jobs or lifestyle involve creating new forms of things, solving complex problems and expressing new ideas: artists, poets, writers, photographers, musicians, designers, journalists, sculptors, architects, IT specialists are developers of computer programs, interfaces, games, and databases. Who else? Scholars and researchers, inventors, hire-up and intangible assets valuation specialists, accounting experts, marketers, lawyers, users and developers of social networks and digital content services. And many other people who day-by-day create intellectual products. Pretty massive audience, isn’t it? Join UDIAR ICO on udiar.io if you have found yourself in this list!

Title: [ANN][ICO] UDIAR - Blockchain-Based Copyright Depository

Will give some details in here: After the token sale all participants could decide whether to keep IAR tokens on project's account (and only in this case token holder could apply for buyback anytime by the formula described in Whitepaper) or to transfer IARs to his/her private Ethereum/Waves vallet. Waves gives an advantage here because you could sell the token on DEX exchange instantly, avoiding the waiting for the token listing on other exchanges which is the only option for Ethereum private vallet holders.  Also we plan to use Waves blockchain for the copyright registration and verification process.  Hope it makes sense

Author: wrc206
Title: [ANN][ICO] UDIAR - Blockchain-Based Copyright Depository
Body: How long does the project exist and why only in Russia?

Author: SPRRW
Title: [ANN][ICO] UDIAR - Blockchain-Based Copyright Depository
Body: hi. The copyrighting technology as it exists in present, was implemented by Russian company EDRID in the begining of 2016. It is only in Russia (and CIS) becuase that for international expansion we need to start using blockchain and solve a range of law issues and language as well, as you can see in a project's roadmap. Russia still holds a neutral position towards blockchain. For security we used CryptoPro encrypting system which is totally accepted by the government (all banking system uses this type of protection, for example). So, we are one of the projects which are in an obvious need for blockchain. That is why this ICO was started - to bring transparency and go across the borders.

Author: freebutcaged
Title: [ANN][ICO] UDIAR - Blockchain-Based Copyright Depository
Body: Questions: 1- I deposit an object with specific details, someone else deposits the same object but with different wording, who is the owner of that object  While they both have been included in a block already?  2- I deposit an object, claim and reserve the copyright for an idea and or brand, someone steals the idea from me, where can I go to reclaim my idea  And who will get me back my rights for me with what jurisdiction? I doubt that Russia goes to war with US if an American company steals my idea.

Author: SPRRW
Title: [ANN][ICO] UDIAR - Blockchain-Based Copyright Depository
Body: Hi. Let's make it clear. 1. What do you mean by different wording? Description of the deposited object or text object inself? Since the system behaves authomatically, both objects will be deposited. But, if the  object is same so the authorship will go to the earliest one (as anyone will see in timestamp). Regardless to any different descriptions. Because description is not an object - it is just accopanying option. So if there would be any disput or suing, the earliest will win. 2. In case of illegal usage of your intellectual property you should apply the system for certificate (real watermark protected paper with crypto stamps). This particular servise is chargeable but really low - 1200 Rub, which is now abound 20USD). This paper is an evidence, a good tool for your lawer.  Actually to reserve rights you need no jurisdition because it is global by it's nature as Berne Convention says (this is the main worlwide document for IP protection wich was ratified by around 190 countries including Russia and US)  The issue is an international recognizing of approval documents. That's why we launched ICO - to overcome this bureaucratic barriers. We want to use blockchain for protection and transparency. After we want to initialize some disput cases to start approving blockchain as an approving tool. Once we succeded (the precedent) - blockchain wiil gain an absolutely new level as a globally recognized approval of.... anything!
